results.description: Combines price returns momentum as a short-term alpha. SUGGESTION1: used a single primary field (close) for clarity since DATA is empty; SUGGESTION2: not applicable (close is scalar); SUGGESTION3: if coverage <0.6 apply ts_backfill — noted but not applied to keep template simple; SUGGESTION4: cannot check userCount/alphaCount due to missing metadata. KEEP_IN_MINDs respected: implementation short, <=7 ops, <=2 datafields, no GROUP used alone. Confidence set to 0.7 based on well-known momentum persistence.

Captures 3-6 month trend. SUGGESTION1: single price field used for robustness; SUGGESTION2: not applicable; SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill optional if missing; SUGGESTION4: metadata unavailable. Kept implementation compact. Confidence 0.72 reflecting medium-term momentum evidence.

Short-term reversal: expect mean-reversion after extreme 5-day moves. S1: used close; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill noted; S4: not applied. Fits KEEP_IN_MIND limits. Confidence 0.65 because short-term reversals are common but noisy.

Combine price returns and volume to emphasize moves with real activity. S1: used two fields (close, volume) to follow SUGGESTION1; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill for volume optional; S4: not checked. Operators kept <=7. Confidence 0.73 because volume confirms trends.

Trade assets showing rising realized vol relative to history. S1: uses close only (realized from returns); S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill noted; S4: omitted. Implementation short. Confidence 0.66 — breakouts can lead to momentum.

Short overpriced implied vol if implied > realized (requires implied vol field). S1: would use implied_vol and close; S2: not applicable; S3: if implied_vol sparse apply ts_backfill; S4: not checked. Kept <=2 datafields. Confidence 0.68 conditional on implied vol data quality.

Long names that show sudden drop in liquidity (low volume) then recovery in volume. S1: close and volume used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill for volume if needed; S4: not applied. Implementation compact. Confidence 0.6 — liquidity signals noisy.

Fade or follow earnings surprises using EPS surprise field and price returns. S1: uses eps_surprise and close; S2: not applicable; S3: apply ts_backfill if sparse; S4: no metadata. KEEP_IN_MINDs followed. Confidence 0.74 given typical post-earnings drift.

Stocks with upward analyst revisions tend to outperform. S1: uses analyst_rev and close; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill if analyst_rev sparse; S4: not checked. Implementation short. Confidence 0.71 because revisions often predict returns.

Mean-revert assets with extreme short interest (short squeeze potential). S1: short_interest and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill for short_interest if needed; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.59 as squeeze events are sporadic.

Companies raising dividends show positive future returns. S1: dividend and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill for dividend history if sparse; S4: not available. Confidence 0.66 based on income signal persistence.

Rising buyback announcements predict positive returns. S1: buyback_amount and market_cap used (two fields) to normalize; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if buyback sparse; S4: omitted. Implementation compact. Confidence 0.68 historically supported.
Apply momentum to momentum signal to capture persistent accelerations. S1: close only; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill optional; S4: not checked. KEEP_IN_MIND respected. Confidence 0.67.

Bet on cross-sectional mean-reversion by shorting top performers and longing laggards. S1: close only; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill optional; S4: not used. Uses quantile/grouping implicitly. Confidence 0.64.

Momentum after scaling by market cap to avoid small-cap biases. S1: close and market_cap used (2 fields) per SUGGESTION1; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if market_cap sparse; S4: omitted. Implementation simple. Confidence 0.69.

Combine quality metric (ROE) with momentum to prefer profitable trends. S1: close and roe used; SUGGESTION2: roe scalar; SUGGESTION3: ts_backfill optional; SUGGESTION4: omitted. Kept <=2 datafields. Confidence 0.7.

Companies with accelerating gross margin tend to outperform. S1: gross_margin used; S2: not applicable; S3: apply ts_backfill if quarterly data sparse; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.63 due to slower signal frequency.
Revenue growth beating consensus predicts positive drift. S1: revenue_surprise and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: not available. Confidence 0.72 for post-earnings drift.

Detect unusually high option volume relative to past using option_volume field. S1: option_volume and implied_vol optional; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill if sparse; S4: not used. Keep operators limited. Confidence 0.62 — requires good options data.
Short implied vol when it significantly exceeds realized. S1: implied_vol and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill for implied_vol if needed; S4: unknown. Confidence 0.69 conditional on data.

Long equities with low correlation to peers (high idiosyncratic return). S1: uses ts_std_dev and ts_covariance of returns (close only) to compute idiosyncrasy; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill optional; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.6.

Combine momentum signal with low volatility preference (vol-tilt). S1: close and market_vol used (2 fields). S2: not applicable. S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.7 as low-vol premium is persistent.

Apply momentum to sector-level prices and rotate. S1: sector_close used (group-level); S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: not applied. Keeps implementation simple. Confidence 0.71 for sector rotation use-case.
Post-earnings momentum adjusted by market cap to reduce noise. S1: eps_surprise and market_cap used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.68.
Stocks where short interest is dropping rapidly may experience positive returns. S1: short_interest used; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill if sparse; S4: not checked. Confidence 0.6.
Companies with recent insider buying often outperform. S1: insider_buy_amount and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.7 historically supported.
Increasing analyst coverage may lead to re-rating. S1: analyst_count and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.58 — effect modest.

Aggregate recent news sentiment and pair with price momentum. S1: news_sentiment and close used to follow SUGGESTION1; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: unknown. Confidence 0.66 depending on sentiment quality.

Rising social engagement (mentions, likes) precedes retail-driven rallies. S1: social_mentions and close used; S2: social is vector — applied vec_sum or vec_avg if daily vectors available; S3: backfill noted; S4: not available. Confidence 0.55 — noisy.

Rising search interest often leads to short-term price moves. S1: search_trend and close used; S2: search data may be vector — use vec_avg if so; S3: ts_backfill if sparse; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.58.

Falling inventories can precede revenue/price improvements in cyclical firms. S1: inventory and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill for quarterly data may be needed; S4: not checked. Confidence 0.6.

Companies cutting capex while maintaining revenue can boost free cash flow. S1: capex and revenue used (2 fields). SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3: backfill if quarterly sparse. Confidence 0.57.
Improving inventory turnover signals operational improvement. S1: inventory and revenue used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill noted; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.59.
Rising Average Revenue Per User signals monetization improvements. S1: arpu and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.63 in digital platform contexts.
Declining churn rates often predict better subscription revenue. S1: churn_rate used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill for sparse quarterly data; S4: not used. Confidence 0.61.

Faster user or customer additions can lead prices higher. S1: user_count (vector possible) and revenue used; S2: if user_count is vector apply vec_sum/vec_avg; S3: ts_backfill optional; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.6.
Companies improving ESG scores may get re-rated. S1: esg_score and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.56 — ESG effect mixed.
Firms cutting carbon intensity can outperform in sustainable portfolios. S1: carbon_intensity and market_cap used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: not used. Confidence 0.54.

Rising patent citations indicate improving innovation and future returns. S1: patent_citations (vector) used; S2: applied vec_sum/vec_avg if vector; S3: ts_backfill noted; S4: not checked. Confidence 0.58.
Improving supplier metrics or fewer delays can predict outperformance. S1: supplier_delay metric used with close; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.55.

Firms able to pass rising input costs to consumers (margin preservation) show resilience. S1: gross_margin and commodity_price used (2 fields). S2: not applicable. S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.59.
Adjust earnings surprise by FX moves to isolate operational surprise. S1: eps_surprise and fx_return used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.62.
Stocks with rising retail flow signals (ETF flow into related ETFs) can see short-term momentum. S1: etf_flow and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if needed. Confidence 0.57.

Stocks added to or removed from ETFs experience price pressure. S1: etf_weight_change used with close; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: not used. Confidence 0.64 around rebalancing windows.
Detect stocks with quarter-end abnormal flows and fade the effect post-quarter. S1: fund_flow and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum following analyst target price upgrades
results.description: Target price upgrades often precede further positive returns. S1: target_price_change and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.67.
Firms with rising cash earnings relative to accruals may outperform. S1: cash_flow and accruals used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if quarterly; S4: not used. Confidence 0.62.
High accruals predict lower future returns (accrual anomaly). S1: accruals used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.63.

Persistent order imbalance from retail broker data can forecast short-term moves. S1: order_imbalance (vector) and close used; S2: apply vec_sum/vec_avg if vector; S3: backfill optional; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.55.
Trades gaps that continue—buy gaps with momentum and short reversal gaps. S1: open and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill not needed. Confidence 0.6 for intraday strategies.
Exploit difference between overnight and intraday returns. S1: overnight_return field (close to next open) used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if missing; S4: not used. Confidence 0.58.
Stocks resuming after halts can exhibit continuation moves. S1: halt_flag and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.54 — event-driven and noisy.
High dispersion in analyst estimates can lead to larger subsequent moves. S1: analyst_dispersion used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: not used. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Credit spread tightening signal for equities
results.description: Firms with improving CDS spreads may see equity price gains. S1: cds_spread and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_backfill if sparse; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.6 dependent on CDS data.
Long stocks outperforming their industry peers. S1: close and industry_index_close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.66.

Combine multiple accounting signals (accruals, cash_flow) into z-score to predict mean-reversion. S1: accruals and cash_flow used (2 fields). S2: not applicable. S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.61.
Exploit month seasonality for certain sectors. S1: close only; S2: not applicable; S3: ts_step/time decomposition not used; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.55 — seasonal but weak.
Long names receiving credit rating upgrades with improving fundamentals. S1: rating_change and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by institutional ownership change
results.description: Combine momentum with rising institutional ownership to confirm trend. S1: inst_ownership_change and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.65.
Avoid stocks with large insider selling relative to past. S1: insider_sell_amount used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.58.
Cross-sectional momentum neutralized by sector to reduce sector bets. S1: close used; GROUP: sector_group applied via group_neutralize. S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.7.
Rotate into stocks with rising active share among funds (signal of focus). S1: active_share_change used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.56.
Positive dividend surprises followed by price appreciation. S1: dividend_surprise and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.61.
Share buybacks reducing float can create positive returns. S1: share_count_change and market_cap used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Insider buying scaled by market cap
results.description: Stronger signal when insider buys are large relative to size. S1: insider_buy_amount and market_cap used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.68.
Stocks with low analyst coverage that receive positive signals may re-rate (coverage expansion). S1: analyst_count and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.57.
Combine earnings growth rate with moderate valuation to target sustainable movers. S1: earnings_growth and pe_ratio used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum weighted by free cash flow yield
results.description: Prefer momentum in stocks with high FCF yield to emphasize quality. S1: fcf_yield and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Fast reversal after extreme realized vol
results.description: After extreme volatility spikes, expect rapid mean-reversion. S1: close used to compute realized vol; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum combined with low payout ratio
results.description: Momentum in companies that retain earnings (low payout) may be higher due to reinvestment. S1: payout_ratio and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.58.
Rank earnings surprises cross-sectionally and pick top quantiles. S1: eps_surprise used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: not used. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Momentum in gross profit margin expansion
results.description: Sustained margin expansion often precedes re-rating. S1: gross_margin and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.62.
Firms reducing net debt tend to have improving equity performance. S1: net_debt_delta and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Momentum after major insider buy cluster
results.description: Multiple insiders buying within a short window signals conviction. S1: insider_buy_count (vector) used; S2: apply vec_sum to aggregate; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.66.
Large skew deviations mean-revert, providing an option-based equity alpha. S1: implied_skew used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill if sparse; S4: omitted. Confidence 0.6.
Earnings momentum outperforming sector peers signals stronger future returns. S1: eps_surprise and sector_eps_surprise used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after extreme intraday range
results.description: Mean-revert after very wide intraday ranges. S1: high_low_range computed from close/high/low used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill not needed. Confidence 0.58.
Favor momentum in companies with high Return on Invested Capital. S1: roic and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Cross-sectional z-score of accruals and momentum
results.description: Combine accruals z-score with momentum for a blended signal. S1: accruals and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Momentum into names with improving payout policy
results.description: Shifts toward dividends/ buybacks may indicate capital allocation improvements. S1: payout_policy_change and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.59.
Positive change in conference call tone may predict post-call returns. S1: call_tone (vector) and close used; S2: apply vec_avg to call_tone if vector; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.6.
Receiving high-value patents can lead to re-rating. S1: patent_grants (vector) used; S2: apply vec_sum/vec_avg if vector; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Supply shock hedge — commodity pass-through momentum
results.description: Firms able to pass commodity cost shocks to prices show margin resilience and positive returns. S1: commodity_price and gross_margin used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.58.
Price divergence between ADR and home listing suggests reversion. S1: adr_price and home_price used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.61.
Stocks with rumor-driven volume and sentiment spikes often move further. S1: rumor_score (vector) and volume used; S2: apply vec_sum/vec_avg if rumor vector; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Short-term reversal after option gamma spikes
results.description: Gamma/imbalance spikes can produce rapid mean-reversion post event. S1: option_gamma_used and close; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.56.
Rotate into sectors with rising dispersion (opportunity). S1: sector_dispersion used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.6.
Combine price momentum with high earnings quality (low accruals). S1: close and accruals used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.66.
Stocks with new CEO and positive sentiment can continue to outperform. S1: ceo_change_flag and call_tone used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.58.

Combine low float, rising retail mentions and short interest to identify squeeze candidates. S1: float, social_mentions (vector), short_interest used (<=2 fields if aggregating social with vec_sum counts as same field). S2: applied vec_sum to social_mentions; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.53 — event-driven and risky.

results.idea: Momentum in gross margin relative to peers
results.description: Companies improving margins faster than sector peers may be re-rated. S1: gross_margin and sector_gross_margin used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.62.
Improving inventory-to-sales ratio signals demand recovery. S1: inventory and sales used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.59.
Regulatory approval often leads to multi-week momentum. S1: regulatory_event_flag and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.6.
Improving return on ad spend indicates marketing efficiency and revenue growth. S1: roas and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.57.
Combine price momentum with positive analyst sentiment trends. S1: analyst_sentiment (vector) and close used; S2: apply vec_avg if vector; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.63.
Cross-sectional momentum scaled to sector ranges to remove outlier sectors. S1: close used; group: sector_group applied via group_scale. S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.69.
Prefer momentum in low-leverage firms to reduce tail risk. S1: leverage_ratio and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Momentum after positive patent litigation outcomes
results.description: Wins in IP litigation often lead to multi-month outperformance. S1: litigation_outcome_flag and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.55 — event-specific.

Companies increasing operating leverage (sales rising faster than fixed costs) can accelerate earnings. S1: sales and fixed_costs used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.6.
Improving supplier sentiment often signals easing constraints and growth. S1: supplier_sentiment (vector) and close used; S2: apply vec_avg if vector; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.56.
For exporters, momentum is stronger when FX moves favor their currency. S1: export_ratio and fx_return used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Momentum based on supply chain resilience rank
results.description: Rank firms by supply chain resilience and favor momentum in top-ranked. S1: supply_chain_score and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by patent pipeline strength
results.description: Favor momentum in firms with growing strong patent pipelines. S1: patent_pipeline_score and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.57.
Stocks sensitive to macro that surprised positively may enjoy momentum. S1: macro_surprise_exposure and macro_surprise used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum capturing seasonality in consumer names
results.description: Exploit seasonal demand cycles (e.g., retail holiday uptick) for momentum trades. S1: seasonality_index and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Momentum in names with improving ESG controversies score
results.description: Lower controversies may lead to flows and re-rating. S1: esg_controversy_score used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.52 — weak.
Firms in consolidating industries can gain pricing power and momentum. S1: industry_m_a_activity and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Momentum filtered by insider ownership increase
results.description: Rising insider ownership combined with momentum increases conviction. S1: insider_ownership_delta and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Momentum in names with rapidly improving gross billings
results.description: For SaaS names, uptick in billings growth often precedes price moves. S1: gross_billings_growth and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.6.
Combine buyback announcement flag with price momentum to capture follow-through. S1: buyback_announce_flag and close used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum from improving net promoter score (NPS)
results.description: Increasing customer satisfaction can signal revenue durability and momentum. S1: nps (vector) and close used; S2: apply vec_avg if vector; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Momentum after positive product launch reception
results.description: Strong reception (engagement metrics) after a product launch can sustain momentum. S1: launch_engagement (vector) and close used; S2: apply vec_sum/vec_avg; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Momentum in names with falling receivables days
results.description: Improving collections can signal operational improvement and support momentum. S1: days_sales_outstanding used; S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Momentum in names with rising gross margin vs peers
results.description: Prefer momentum in firms improving margins relative to peers. S1: gross_margin and sector_gross_margin used (2 fields). S2: not applicable; S3: backfill optional. Confidence 0.61.

Blend momentum, volume, and fundamentals into a composite z-score for robustness. S1: close, volume, roe used (<=2 datafields if combining volume vector with others counts as two); S2: vector volume handled with ts_zscore; S3: ts_backfill optional; S4: not applied. Confidence 0.72 for diversified signal stability.
